text: This is a list of people who served as the governor of New York. == List of governors == Governor Term in office Time in office Party Election Lieutenant Governor 1 George Clinton – June 30, 1795 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican 1777 Pierre Van Cortlandt 1780 1783 1786 1789 1792 2 John Jay – June 30, 1801 (not candidate for election) Federalist 1795 Stephen Van Rensselaer 1798 3 George Clinton – June 30, 1804 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican 1801 Jeremiah Van Rensselaer 4 Morgan Lewis – June 30, 1807 (lost election) Democratic– Republican 1804 John Broome (died August 8, 1810) 5 Daniel D. Tompkins – February 24, 1817 (resigned) Democratic– Republican 1807 1810 Vacant John Tayler (acting) (took office January 29, 1811) DeWitt Clinton (elected May 2, 1811) 1813 John Tayler 1816 6 John Tayler – June 30, 1817 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican Lieutenant Governor acting as Governor Philetus Swift (acting) 7 DeWitt Clinton – December 31, 1822 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican 1817 John Tayler 1820 8 Joseph C. Yates – December 31, 1824 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican 1822 Erastus Root 9 DeWitt Clinton – February 11, 1828 (died in office) Democratic– Republican 1824 James Tallmadge Jr. 1826 Nathaniel Pitcher 10 Nathaniel Pitcher – December 31, 1828 (not candidate for election) Democratic– Republican Succeeded from Lieutenant Governor Peter R. title: List of governors of New York
